revised_title: Fiber Arrangement in the Stomach Musculature of Mammals
tldr: This study examines the arrangement of fibers in the muscular tunics of the stomach in various mammals, including humans. The author uses various methods to visualize and analyze the fibers, finding that they form a complex network of spiral fibers that create figure-of-8 loops. These loops are directed towards the stomach's greater and lesser curvatures and contribute to the formation of sphincter-like structures at the entrance and exit of the stomach. The study also discusses the layers and thickness of the stomach's muscular coat and its variations across different species.
